Package wellen

Class DSPTrack

  • java.lang.Object
    • wellen.DSPModule
      • wellen.DSPTrack
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DSPNodeOutputSignal, Loopable
    public class DSPTrack
extends DSPModule
    manages a collection of DSPModules. each child module processes audio signals which are accumulated by the track. furthermore, DSPTrack calls its child modules 
    void beat(int)
    method.

    note, that since DSPTrack implements DSPModule it can also be added as a module to another track. if a class is derived from DSPTrack and 

    beat(int)
    is overridden make sure to call 
    beat_update(int)
    to preserve internal functionality and update for child DSPModules. similarly, make sure to call 
    Signal output_signal_update()
    if 
    Signal output_signal()
    is overridden.

    DSPTrack handles mono or stereo DSPModules. if a DSPModule outputs a mono signal the output is positioned via panning ( see DSPModule 

    pan()
    ). if a DSPModule outputs a stereo signal the output ignores panning and just uses the signal unchanged. if a DSPModule outputs more than channels than a stereo signal all additional channels are ignored.
    See Also:
    DSPModule

      • modules

        public java.util.ArrayList<DSPModule> modules()

      • module

        public DSPModule module​(int pIndex)
        Parameters:
        pIndex - index of track as stored in 
        modules()
        . note that this not to be confused with the final field 
        .ID
        in DSPModule which refers to a unique ID for each module ever created.
        Returns:
        module stored at index

      • beat

        public void beat​(int pBeat)
        triggered by beat mechanism. this method can be overridden to implement custom behavior, however, if doing so make sure to call 
        void beat_update(int)
        to pass beat event onto child modules.
        Overrides:
        beat in class DSPModule
        Parameters:
        pBeat - current beat count

      • beat_update

        public void beat_update​(int pBeat)
        updates everything related to beat functionality including internal mechanisms and child modules.
        Parameters:
        pBeat - current beat count

      • output_signal

        public Signal output_signal()
        callback method that accumulates audio signals from child modules and if applicable maps mono signals into stereo space. this method can be overridden to implement custom behavior, however, if doing so make sure to call 
        Signal output_signal_update()
        to collect signals from child modules.
        Returns:
        Signal of this track

      • output_signal_update

        public Signal output_signal_update()
